## 3. Data preparation

### 3.1. Questionnaires

#### *3.1.1. HMPS (SOP, SPP, OOP)*

```         
*Reverse-coded items*

dat[,c("HMPS_2", "HMPS_3", "HMPS_4", "HMPS_8", "HMPS_9", "HMPS_10", "HMPS_12", "HMPS_19", "HMPS_21", "HMPS_24", "HMPS_30", "HMPS_34", "HMPS_36", "HMPS_37", "HMPS_38", "HMPS_43","HMPS_44", "HMPS_45")] <- 8 - dat[,c("HMPS_2", "HMPS_3", "HMPS_4", "HMPS_8", "HMPS_9", "HMPS_10", "HMPS_12", "HMPS_19", "HMPS_21", "HMPS_24", "HMPS_30", "HMPS_34", "HMPS_36", "HMPS_37", "HMPS_38", "HMPS_43", "HMPS_44", "HMPS_45")] 

*Subdimensions*

dat["SOP"] <- dat$HMPS_1 + dat$HMPS_6 + dat$HMPS_8 + dat$HMPS_12 + dat$HMPS_14 + dat$HMPS_15 + dat$HMPS_17 + dat$HMPS_20 + dat$HMPS_23 + dat$HMPS_28 + dat$HMPS_32 + dat$HMPS_34 + dat$HMPS_36 + dat$HMPS_40 + dat$HMPS_42

dat["OOP"] <- dat$HMPS_2 + dat$HMPS_3 + dat$HMPS_4 + dat$HMPS_7 + dat$HMPS_10 + dat$HMPS_16 + dat$HMPS_19 + dat$HMPS_22 + dat$HMPS_24 + dat$HMPS_26 + dat$HMPS_27 + dat$HMPS_29 + dat$HMPS_38 + dat$HMPS_43 + dat$HMPS_45

dat["SPP"] <- dat$HMPS_5 + dat$HMPS_9 + dat$HMPS_11 + dat$HMPS_13 + dat$HMPS_18 + dat$HMPS_21 + dat$HMPS_25 + dat$HMPS_30 + dat$HMPS_31 + dat$HMPS_33 + dat$HMPS_35 + dat$HMPS_37 + dat$HMPS_39 + dat$HMPS_41 + dat$HMPS_44
```

#### *3.1.2. FMPS (PS, CM, DA, PE, PC, O)*

```         
dat["PS"] <- dat$FMPS_4 + dat$FMPS_6 + dat$FMPS_12 + dat$FMPS_16 + dat$FMPS_19 + dat$FMPS_24 + dat$FMPS_30

dat["CM"] <- dat$FMPS_9 + dat$FMPS_10 + dat$FMPS_13 + dat$FMPS_14 + dat$FMPS_18 + dat$FMPS_21 + dat$FMPS_23 + dat$FMPS_25 + dat$FMPS_34

dat["DA"] <- dat$FMPS_17 + dat$FMPS_28 + dat$FMPS_32 + dat$FMPS_33 

dat["PE"] <- dat$FMPS_1 + dat$FMPS_11 + dat$FMPS_15 + dat$FMPS_20 + dat$FMPS_26 

dat["PC"] <- dat$FMPS_3 + dat$FMPS_5 + dat$FMPS_22 + dat$FMPS_35 

dat["O"] <- dat$FMPS_2 + dat$FMPS_7 + dat$FMPS_8 + dat$FMPS_27 + dat$FMPS_29 + dat$FMPS_31
```

#### *3.1.3. Perfectionism Subdimensions (Perfectionistic Concerns and Perfectionistic Strivings)*

```         
dat[c("ZSOP", "ZOOP", "ZSPP", "ZPS", "ZPE", "ZPC","ZCM", "ZDA", "ZO")] <- scale(dat[c("SOP", "OOP", "SPP", "PS", "PE", "PC","CM", "DA", "O")])

dat["Perf_Strivings"] <- dat$"ZPS" + dat$"ZSOP"

dat["Perf_Concerns"] <- dat$"ZCM" + dat$"ZDA" + dat$"ZSPP"
```

#### *3.3.3. Q-Q Plots*

```         
qqplot_SOP <- ggplot(dat, aes(sample = SOP)) +
geom_qq() + geom_qq_line(color = "pink", size = 1) + labs(title = "QQ-Plot for SOP", x = "Theoretical Quantiles", y = "SOP Quantiles") + theme_minimal()

### 4.2. Step 3 : Differential Item Functioning (DIF) analysis

#### *4.2.1. Self-Oriented Perfectionism (SOP)*

```         
dat["SOP"] <- dat$HMPS_1 + dat$HMPS_6 + dat$HMPS_8 + dat$HMPS_12 + dat$HMPS_14 + dat$HMPS_15 + dat$HMPS_17 + dat$HMPS_20 + dat$HMPS_23 + dat$HMPS_28 + dat$HMPS_32 + dat$HMPS_34 + dat$HMPS_36 + dat$HMPS_40 + dat$HMPS_42

sd_SOP <- sd(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's standard deviation is :", sd_SOP, "\n")
    [= 16.82]

mean_SOP <- mean(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's mean is :", mean_SOP, "\n")
    [= 66.80]

    --> [49.98; 83.62]

HighVsLowSOP <- ifelse(dat$SOP >= 83.62, 1, ifelse(dat$SOP < 49.98, -1, 0))
AMT_Matrix <- dat[, c("Decline_ThreeCategories", "Record_ThreeCategories", "Progression_ThreeCategories", "Performance_ThreeCategories", "Fiasco_ThreeCategories", "Neglect_ThreeCategories")]
AMTDIF_SOP_3categories <- lordif(AMT_Matrix, HighVsLowSOP, criterion = "Chisqr", alpha = 0.01,  minCell = 1)
print(AMTDIF_SOP_3categories)

### 3.1. Questionnaires

#### *3.1.1. HMPS (SOP, SPP, OOP)*

```

dat["SOP"] <- dat$HMPS_1 + dat$HMPS_6 + dat$HMPS_8 + dat$HMPS_12 + dat$HMPS_14 + dat$HMPS_15 + dat$HMPS_17 + dat$HMPS_20 + dat$HMPS_23 + dat$HMPS_28 + dat$HMPS_32 + dat$HMPS_34 + dat$HMPS_36 + dat$HMPS_40 + dat$HMPS_42

#### *3.1.2. FMPS (PS, CM, DA, PE, PC, O)*

```         
dat["PS"] <- dat$FMPS_4 + dat$FMPS_6 + dat$FMPS_12 + dat$FMPS_16 + dat$FMPS_19 + dat$FMPS_24 + dat$FMPS_30

dat["CM"] <- dat$FMPS_9 + dat$FMPS_10 + dat$FMPS_13 + dat$FMPS_14 + dat$FMPS_18 + dat$FMPS_21 + dat$FMPS_23 + dat$FMPS_25 + dat$FMPS_34

dat["O"] <- dat$FMPS_2 + dat$FMPS_7 + dat$FMPS_8 + dat$FMPS_27 + dat$FMPS_29 + dat$FMPS_31
```

#### *3.1.3. Perfectionism Subdimensions (Perfectionistic Concerns and Perfectionistic Strivings)*

```         
dat[c("ZSOP", "ZOOP", "ZSPP", "ZPS", "ZPE", "ZPC","ZCM", "ZDA", "ZO")] <- scale(dat[c("SOP", "OOP", "SPP", "PS", "PE", "PC","CM", "DA", "O")])

dat["Perf_Strivings"] <- dat$"ZPS" + dat$"ZSOP"

### 4.2. Step 3 : Differential Item Functioning (DIF) analysis

#### *4.2.1. Self-Oriented Perfectionism (SOP)*

```         
dat["SOP"] <- dat$HMPS_1 + dat$HMPS_6 + dat$HMPS_8 + dat$HMPS_12 + dat$HMPS_14 + dat$HMPS_15 + dat$HMPS_17 + dat$HMPS_20 + dat$HMPS_23 + dat$HMPS_28 + dat$HMPS_32 + dat$HMPS_34 + dat$HMPS_36 + dat$HMPS_40 + dat$HMPS_42

sd_SOP <- sd(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's standard deviation is :", sd_SOP, "\n")
    [= 15.88]

mean_SOP <- mean(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's Mean is :", mean_SOP, "\n")
    [= 70.89]

    --> [55.01; 86.77]

HighVsLowSOP <- ifelse(dat$SOP >= 86.77, 1, ifelse(dat$SOP < 55.01, -1, 0))

### 4.2. Step 3 : Differential Item Functioning (DIF) analysis

#### *4.2.1. Self-Oriented Perfectionism (SOP)*

```         
dat["SOP"] <- dat$HMPS_1 + dat$HMPS_6 + dat$HMPS_8 + dat$HMPS_12 + dat$HMPS_14 + dat$HMPS_15 + dat$HMPS_17 + dat$HMPS_20 + dat$HMPS_23 + dat$HMPS_28 + dat$HMPS_32 + dat$HMPS_34 + dat$HMPS_36 + dat$HMPS_40 + dat$HMPS_42

sd_SOP <- sd(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's standard deviation is :", sd_SOP, "\n")
    [= 14.96]

mean_SOP <- mean(dat$SOP, na.rm = TRUE)
cat("SOP's mean is :", mean_SOP, "\n")
    [= 70.67]

    --> [55.71; 85.63]

HighVsLowSOP <- ifelse(dat$SOP >= 85.63, 1, ifelse(dat$SOP < 55.71, -1, 0))
AMT_Matrix <- dat[, c("Decline_ThreeCategories", "Record_ThreeCategories", "Progression_ThreeCategories", "Performance_ThreeCategories", "Fiasco_ThreeCategories", "Neglect_ThreeCategories")]
AMTDIF_SOP_3categories <- lordif(AMT_Matrix, HighVsLowSOP, criterion = "Chisqr", alpha = 0.01,  minCell = 1)
print(AMTDIF_SOP_3categories)

    Number of DIF groups: 3 
    Number of items flagged for DIF: 0 of 6 
    Items flagged:  
    Number of iterations for purification: 1 of 10
